text: TLS can be configured to require authentication from all clients running outside the local host. After you have set up TLS, as described in Enable One-way SSL On RCP , follow the steps below to enable Two-way SSL server authentication on RCP. The Platform will then request valid certificates from each connecting pico instance. There are two methods to make the client/server certificates available on all containers: Using The Same Keystore Creating A New Keystore
title: Enable Two-way SSL On RCP - MediationZone Documentation 9.4 - InfoZone
